dialogues.speaker: NICK/KURT/DALE
dialogues.text: No!/Oh no!/No, no!

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: It’s Nick, Kurt and Dale combined. Nickurdale. It’s our company name.

dialogues.speaker: HAGAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, you need to change that company name.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: We’re not going to have a company, or our lives, if you don’t help us take down Nagopian.

dialogues.speaker: HAGAN
dialogues.text: Nagopian?

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Yeah. Alex Nagopian. He’s the guy we borrowed money from.

dialogues.speaker: HAGAN
dialogues.text: Get outta here.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: What? You know him?

dialogues.speaker: HAGAN
dialogues.text: We’ve been watching him for years. The Feds think he’s the head of Armenian Power.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: What’s Armenian Power?

dialogues.speaker: HAGAN
dialogues.text: It’s the Armenian mob.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: That’s great. That’s perfect. We borrowed money from a mob boss.  61.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: (to Hagan) Hang on. If you know he’s a criminal, why don’t you arrest him?

dialogues.speaker: HAGAN
dialogues.text: Nagopian’s smart. He keeps himself insulated from the shit his gang does. And as far as we can tell, this here was just an accident.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: And what happens on Monday when the three of us also die in accidents?

dialogues.speaker: HAGAN
dialogues.text: Well, then I’ll have a case.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Will you at least come with us to Nagopian’s office where I met with him? I bet there’s a ton of evidence there. Hagan looks at his watch and sighs.

dialogues.speaker: HAGAN
dialogues.text: I was going to watch “American Horror Story” with my wife. (beat) Shit. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt’s WINDOWLESS car pulls up to the Venture Partners International building followed by Hagan’s unmarked car. and the guys get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hagan and the guys ride in the elevator. There’s an awkwa silence. Then,

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: (to Hagan) How have you been? Hagan just gives him a contemptuous look. The doors open and they all step out into  62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was Venture Partners International is now the west c corporate headquarters of Quiznos Sandwiches.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. What floor is this?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Five.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: This wasn’t here. This was Nagopian’s office!

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Are you sure we’re in the right building?

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Yes! I pitched Nagopian right here! Dale points to the room we saw earlier, but it’s now occu by a middle-aged executive, TIM, at a desk.

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: Hi, you must be my five o'clock.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: You're not Nagopian.

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: No... Are you my five o’clock?

dialogues.speaker: HAGAN
dialogues.text: (to the guys) You're telling me you dragged me clear across town to visit some goddamn sandwich company?

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: We also have salads and flatbreads.

dialogues.speaker: HAGAN
dialogues.text: This is some bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: (to Tim) How long have you been in this office?

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: Since the building opened last week. We’re the first tenants. (then, realizing) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: TIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're not my five o’clock, are you? Hagan shakes his head and goes to leave. The guys hurry after him.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Wait. You can’t just leave.

dialogues.speaker: HAGAN
dialogues.text: Watch me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s dark now and it’s begun to drizzle as Hagan crosses his car with the guys on his heels.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Detective, if you go, we’re as good as dead.

dialogues.speaker: HAGAN
dialogues.text: Since I’ve known you three, nothing you've told me has been true. Why would I listen to you now?

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Can’t you at least give us some police protection?

dialogues.speaker: HAGAN
dialogues.text: Protection from what? Your own foolishness? Hagan climbs into his car.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: So you're just going to drive away and leave us riding a cat without a candle?!

dialogues.speaker: HAGAN
dialogues.text: The hell you say?

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: It’s an expression.

dialogues.speaker: HAGAN
dialogues.text: No it isn’t. Hagan slams the door and drives off.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I don’t understand. If Quiznos was the first tenant, how was Nagopian’s office there?  64.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: I know how. Quiznos is in on this. I didn’t see a single sandwich up there. And who puts a Quiznos on the fifth floor of an office building--? Kurt puts a hand over Dale’s mouth and keeps it there.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: (to Nick) What do we do now?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Let’s figure it out in the car. There’s no point standing out here in the rain.

dialogues.speaker: SMASH CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. KURT’S CAR - MINUTES LATER Kurt drives. Nick is up front and Dale in the back. Witho the benefit of a windshield or a sunroof, WIND-DRIVEN RAI soaks the guys as they drive. Kurt shields his eyes with hand so he can see. They yell over the wind.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Glad we got out of the rain! The windshield wipers flop ridiculously across the dashbo

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Maybe we should all stay together tonight! Might be safer!

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Good idea! But not my place! I don’t want my pregnant wife to get blown up!

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Kurt, your apartment is probably the most secure!

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Okay, we can-- Just then, a wet PLASTIC BAG flies through the open windshield and sticks to Kurt’s face. The car VEERS wildl as he tries to pull the bag off. Nick and Dale scream.  65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still damp, the guys exit the car and head for the stairs Kurt absentmindedly locks his windowless car. BEEP.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: It’s good that you locked it. They head for the stairs to Kurt’s loft.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: We've got to establish a secure perimeter at your place. Booby traps, an early warning system... I’m going to need twine, small bells, thumb tacks, mousetraps--

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Calm down, Macaulay Culkin. I've got an alarm system.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: I guess that’1l work. INT. KURT’S LOFT - MOMENTS LATER The door to Kurt’s loft opens and the guys enter.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: So what exactly will we do if they show up?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: We'll figure that out. The main thing is that we’re ready for them if they do come. Kurt flips on the lights and they all gasp as they see Nagopian’s thug, Ghoukas, sitting on the sofa, pointing a at them. Another armed THUG appears behind them in the ha

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Oh god.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (to Kurt) I thought you said you had an alarm.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: I never turn it on.

dialogues.speaker: GHOUKAS
dialogues.text: Let's go. Ghoukas and the other thug usher them back out.  66.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Can I at least feed my dog first?

dialogues.speaker: GHOUKAS
dialogues.text: Your dog doesn’t need to be fed anymore.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: (horrified) You killed my dog?!

dialogues.speaker: GHOUKAS
dialogues.text: I fed him.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Oh. (beat) Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An SUV pulls up to a construction trailer which is set up beside an unfinished 10-story office building. Ghoukas an the other thug open the door and escort the guys toward t trailer. Kurt notices a sign reading “Nagopian Construction.”

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: (to the guys) He’s also got a construction company?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: That’s probably how he set up in that other building before it opened.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Wow. Construction, venture capital, mob boss. He’s a real Renaissance man. INT. NAGOPIAN’S CONSTRUCTION TRAILER - MOMENTS LATER Nick, Kurt and Dale stand across from Nagopian who sits a metal desk covered in blueprints. Ghoukas and the other t hover nearby.

dialogues.speaker: MR. NAGOPIAN
dialogues.text: So you don’t have my money?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: It’s just not possible to double a million dollar loan in one month.  67.

dialogues.speaker: MR. NAGOPIAN
dialogues.text: Not normally, no.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Come on, man. There has to be a more reasonable payment plan option.

dialogues.speaker: MR. NAGOPIAN
dialogues.text: Of course there is. It’s called “The Ghoukas Kills You” plan. Ghoukas snickers. Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: MR. NAGOPIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here’s what I’m thinking... (to Kurt and Nick) On your way home, you two will die in a terrible car accident. Your bodies will be so badly burned, it will be impossible for forensics to know that you were already dead before the car crashed.

dialogues.speaker: KURT NICK
dialogues.text: So specific.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: (nervously) What about me?

dialogues.speaker: MR. NAGOPIAN
dialogues.text: You? (considers, then) Auto-erotic asphyxiation.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Wha?

dialogues.speaker: MR. NAGOPIAN
dialogues.text: The police will find you hanging from a belt with your cock in your hand.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Aw, man! Can’t I just be in the car with them?

dialogues.speaker: MR. NAGOPIAN
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Well, isn’t there another way I can die?  68.

dialogues.speaker: MR. NAGOPIAN
dialogues.text: Fine. (beat) The police will find you with your head in the oven.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: That’s better.

dialogues.speaker: MR. NAGOPIAN
dialogues.text: .»+-and your cock in your hand.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: c'mon!

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Wait. You don’t want to kill us. Dale's wife is pregnant with triplets.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: That’s right.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: What if he were to give you two of his babies?

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Wait, what?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (to Kurt) What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: (to Nagopian) Dale keeps one. You get two. You sell them on the black market. Come on. Two healthy white babies? That’s got to be worth a million right there.

dialogues.speaker: MR. NAGOPIAN
dialogues.text: It’s worth sixty thousand.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Creepy that you know that.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: I’m not selling my babies anyway.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: You've got three! Don’t be selfish. (then, to Nagopian) What if Dale sucks your dick?  69.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Selfish!

dialogues.speaker: MR. NAGOPIAN
dialogues.text: Ghoukas. Drank’ herru. Ghoukas takes out his gun and gestures them toward the do The guys exchange a dire look.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Wait. Please. There has to be another way. Isn’t there anything we can do for you? Anything at all?

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Dale will do anything. Nagopian’s Thug snorts and chimes in.

dialogues.speaker: THUG
dialogues.text: Nrank' karogh yen goghanal arrak'man.

dialogues.speaker: MR. NAGOPIAN
dialogues.text: (laughing) Vor urakh kliner.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: What is that? What’s he saying?

dialogues.speaker: MR. NAGOPIAN
dialogues.text: (to Ghoukas) Spasel. Ghoukas stops the guys.

dialogues.speaker: MR. NAGOPIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There is one thing.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Okay, great. What is it?

dialogues.speaker: MR. NAGOPIAN
dialogues.text: Today I sold a truck to Arana Pandilla.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Who’s he?

dialogues.speaker: MR. NAGOPIAN
dialogues.text: It’s not a “he.” It’s a Dominican street gang. And they’re assholes. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: MR. NAGOPIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They're keeping the truck at a strip club they own. If you can steal it from them and bring it back to me tonight, I’1l consider your debt paid.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Why would you steal back something you just sold?

dialogues.speaker: MR. NAGOPIAN
dialogues.text: Because that way I get their money and my truck back.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: This truck must mean a lot to you. Has it been in your family a long time?

dialogues.speaker: MR. NAGOPIAN
dialogues.text: What? No. I don’t give a shit about the truck. I want what’s in the truck!

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: What’s in the truck?

dialogues.speaker: MR. NAGOPIAN
dialogues.text: None of your fucking business. Just get it back by sun-up. And if you try to run--

dialogues.speaker: GHOUKAS
dialogues.text: Something terrible may or may not happen to you and your families.

dialogues.speaker: MR. NAGOPIAN
dialogues.text: No, Ghoukas! We’re past the conceit now.

dialogues.speaker: GHOUKAS
dialogues.text: Oh. (to the guys) I‘1l kill you and your families.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SUV driven by Ghoukas heads off, leaving Nick, Kurt a Dale standing on the curb.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Now where the fuck are we?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (pointing) That must be the strip club.  71. A block away from them is a seedy, unwelcoming club with neon sign that reads “PUTAS DESNUDAS.”

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: “Putas Desnudas”? What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: “Naked Whores.”

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Kind of on-the-nose, huh?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I don’t see a truck. They walk closer to the club and notice around the corner a fenced-in parking lot with an 18-wheeler parked inside. TWO heavily tattooed HISPANIC GUARDS stand nearby. quickly back up into the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Look at this. A locked fence, guards. It’s a suicide mission.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I think that’s what Nagopian had in mind.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Those guys have tattoos on their faces. That does not bode well.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: If it were easy to rob a truck from one gang and give it to another, people would be doing it all the time.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: I had no idea starting a small business would be this hard.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: All right, let’s just put our heads together and figure out how to pull this off without getting killed. There’s a long beat.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: (to himself) What would Ocean’s 11 do?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Well, first of all, they’d have eight more people. Our guys  72.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: And I don’t think we’re going to have to do backflips through a room full of lasers in there.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: You're thinking of Catherine Zeta- Jones in “Entrapment.”

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: No, I’m not. Catherine Zeta-Jones was also in “Ocean’s 11.”

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: No, she wasn’t. She was in “Ocean’s 12.”

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: It was the same cast.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Yeah, plus a twelfth person: Catherine Zeta-Jones.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: You’re an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Am I?! Okay, I’m iMDB’ing it. He starts furiously typing into his smart phone.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Probably not the best use of our time.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Well, there is one thing all those movies had in common. Besides Catherine Zeta-Jones.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: (still typing) No.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: (to Nick) They always created a distraction so the rest of the team could carry out the heist.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: That’s true. Maybe create a commotion inside the club. Draw the guards in.  73.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: What are you thinking? Smoke pellets?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Do you have smoke pellets?

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Do you know how to make smoke pellets?

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Guess that rules out smoke pellets. (then) What if two of us stage a fake fight in there? Get everyone watching that.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: That only leaves one of us to hot- wire the truck and no one to keep a lookout.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: What did I say?! (holds up his phone) Ocean’s 11! No Catherine Zeta-Jo-- Kurt swats the phone out of Dale’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: DALE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey! Dale scrambles after it. Kurt turns back to Nick as if nothing happened.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: We’re gonna need a fourth person.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Who do we know that we can call at one in the morning to help us commit a really dangerous crime?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys sit in their regular booth across from MOTHERFUC JONES.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHERFUCKER
dialogues.text: You three clowns just can’t abide by the law, can you?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Clearly, some bad decisions were made. Now can you please help us, Motherfucker Jones?

dialogues.speaker: MOTHERFUCKER
dialogues.text: What’d you call me?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Motherfucker Jones. Isn’t that your name?

dialogues.speaker: MOTHERFUCKER
dialogues.text: Not anymore. I changed it when I got married.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Oh, congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHERFUCKER
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Your wife didn’t like the name “Motherfucker”?

dialogues.speaker: MOTHERFUCKER
dialogues.text: No, bitch. She didn’t like the name “Jones.” I took her last name.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Really.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: (to Motherfucker) So what’s your name now?

dialogues.speaker: MOTHERFUCKER
dialogues.text: Motherfucker Quang. She’s Chinese. The hot kind. Not the big round head kind.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: So she was okay with “Motherfucker” but she didn’t like “Jones”?  75.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHERFUCKER
dialogues.text: I’m pretty sure she doesn’t know what the word “motherfucker” means. She doesn’t know what a lot of words mean.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: She sounds nice.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: But why did you take her last name?

dialogues.speaker: MOTHERFUCKER
dialogues.text: Because I respect women and I believe in equality.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: That’s fair.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHERFUCKER
dialogues.text: And because she does everything I tell her to do. No matter how fucked up.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: (to himself) That took a weird turn.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Okay, we don’t have a lot of time here. So we need to know if you’ll help us, Motherfucker... Quang?

dialogues.speaker: MOTHERFUCKER
dialogues.text: I'll help you. But it’1l be fifty large.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Here we go.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: No. It’s not going to be fifty large. It’s not going to be anything large. It’s going to be small.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHERFUCKER
dialogues.text: (sighs, then) All right. Gimme your watch.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: This is a Tag Heuer.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHERFUCKER
dialogues.text: I know what it is.  76.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Just give it to him, Nick. Nick rolls his eyes and gives Motherfucker the watch.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHERFUCKER
dialogues.text: Thank you. From here on out, I’m going to be your heist consultant. They all ad lib “no’s” as they usher him out of the booth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys stand with Motherfucker across from the strip cl parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHERFUCKER
dialogues.text: I don’t know about this. You didn’t tell me these guys had tattoos on their faces.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: You have tattoos on your head!

dialogues.speaker: MOTHERFUCKER
dialogues.text: That's different. I grow out my hair, I look like everyone else. They grow out their hair, they look even crazier.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: We can’t turn back now.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHERFUCKER
dialogues.text: I can. He turns and starts to walk away.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Wait! We’ll give you stock in Nickurdale.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHERFUCKER
dialogues.text: (shocked) Nigger what?!

dialogues.speaker: NICK/KURT/DALE
dialogues.text: No, no!/That’s not--/Oh boy.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Ni-Kur-Dale. It’s the name of our company.  77.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHERFUCKER
dialogues.text: Yeah, you gotta change that name. (beat) How much stock?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: A thousand shares.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHERFUCKER
dialogues.text: Ten thousand.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Done.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: (leaning in to Nick) I didn’t know we have stock.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (sotto) We don’t.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Okay, here’s how I see this going down. Motherfucker and I will stage a fight in the club. As soon as the guards come inside to break it up, you and Dale climb the fence, hot wire the truck, drive it through the fence and pick us up out front.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Seems like Dale and I have the much harder end of the plan.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? Do you know how hard it is to stage a convincing fake fight? The only reason I’ve chosen myself for it is because--

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (rolling his eyes) Don’t say “West Side Story.”

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: “West Side Story.” The school paper said I was the most convincing Bernardo they’d ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: (leaning in to Motherfucker) Bernardo is Maria’s brother. The leader of the Sharks.  78. Motherfucker just stares at Dale.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I was Tony. I know how to fake fight too.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Come on, Nick. You know Tony avoided all the rumbles like a little bitch. Bernardo was deep in the shit the whole show. (then) Dale, you saw the show. Which of us was the better fake fighter?

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: (delicately) You were. Nick scoffs.

dialogues.speaker: DALE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You were the better dancer, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHERFUCKER
dialogues.text: Fuck this shit. Motherfucker turns and starts to walk away.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Okay, wait Motherfucker-- You and Kurt will do the fake fight, Dale and I will steal the truck. Somehow.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Good luck, guys.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: The Sharks are going to have their way tonight. As they split up, Motherfucker turns to Kurt.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHERFUCKER
dialogues.text: You three should just fuck each other already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt and Motherfucker enter the dimly-lit club which is populated by dozens of Arafia Pandilla GANG BANGERS who g them with hostile looks. On a stage, a STRIPPER works the pole.  79.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Damn. This place makes your bar look like the Cheesecake Factory. They take a seat at a table near the stage and eye their surroundings nervously.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHERFUCKER
dialogues.text: So, how do you want to do this?

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: I guess we should start with some raised voices, then I’1l throw the first punch. I won’t touch you, but it’1ll be close, so you gotta pretend I made contact. Then we’1l just sort of wing it from there. WWE style.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHERFUCKER
dialogues.text: (raising his voice) That sounds good to me!

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: (also raising his voice) Oh, okay! We're going right into this?! Kurt stands, knocking his chair down. Motherfucker does t same. A few heads turn. It’s hard for other people to hea what they’re yelling over the music.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHERFUCKER
dialogues.text: Fuck yeah, we are! Motherfucker grabs Kurt by the shirt.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: ‘Cause I kinda wanted to psych myself up for it a little more! Kurt gives Motherfucker a little shove.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHERFUCKER
dialogues.text: Might as well get this over with, ‘cause I gotta work in the morning!

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: (“angrily”) I didn’t know you had a job! What do you do?! Motherfucker shoves Kurt back.  80.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHERFUCKER
dialogues.text: (“furious”) I run the coffee shop at a Barnes and Noble!

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: wi (“outraged”) ice! Motherfucker grabs a bottle and breaks it on the edge of table.

dialogues.speaker: KURT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (still threatening) Oh, shit! Don’t tell me you’re actually gonna use that bottle! ‘Cause that would really hurt me!

dialogues.speaker: MOTHERFUCKER
dialogues.text: (getting in his face) Don’t worry! I won't! Motherfucker sets the bottle on the table. By now, most o the bar patrons are watching this “fight.”

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: I’m gonna punch you in the face with my right hand! You ready for that?!

dialogues.speaker: MOTHERFUCKER
dialogues.text: Bring it! Kurt winds back and PUNCHES Motherfucker in the face, but instead of missing him, he accidentally NAILS HIM RIGHT I THE NOSE. Motherfucker falls back and clutches his face.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: (realizing) Oh my god, I’m so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHERFUCKER
dialogues.text: You hit me! Motherfucker looks at his hand and sees that his nose is bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: I know. You must’ve leaned into it.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHERFUCKER
dialogues.text: Leaned into it?! I’11 lean into you, bitch! Now angry for real, Motherfucker punches Kurt.  81.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Ow! Hey!

dialogues.speaker: MOTHERFUCKER
dialogues.text: You want another one, Bernardo?! The patrons regard this scuffle with little interest. Motherfucker lunges for Kurt, who tries to fend him off w a chair. But instead of hitting Motherfucker with it, he swings it into a table where TWO GANG MEMBERS sit.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Uh oh. The gang members stand up and grab the chair from Kurt. O of them HURLS it at him but Kurt DODGES at the last secon and the chair flies into another GANG MEMBER who looks pissed. All at once, the club ERUPTS IN A FRENZY of chair-throwin punching and brawling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Dale stand in the shadows, watching the club's parking lot. Nick notices a THUG come out of the club and gesture for the two guards to come inside. They leave the posts and head in.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Look. They're going in.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Now’s our chance. They sneak over to the 10-foot chain-link fence, topped w barbed wire, that encloses the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: There’s barbed wire. How do we get over that?

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Not a problem. Dale takes off his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: I’ve seen people do this. You toss your jacket onto the barbed wire and then you just climb over it.  82.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Okay. Do it. Dale tosses his jacket up... and right over the fence whe it lands on the ground on the other side. Nick gives hima look.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: I overshot it. Dale tries to fish his jacket through a link in the fence it’s too thick and he only manages to wedge it halfway through.

dialogues.speaker: DALE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Damn it. (then) Can I have your jacket?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: No. I’11 do it. Nick takes his jacket off puts his over his shoulder, the carefully climbs up the fence.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Oh, you’re not going to toss it from the ground? That makes sense... Nick reaches the top and drapes his coat over the barbed wire. He delicately clambers over the top.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (hushed) Ow. Ow! Shit! He reaches the ground.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: See? I told you that would work.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Didn’t work at all, Dale. Went right through the jacket. Nick holds out his hands which are flecked with bloody scratches.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Oof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt and Motherfucker cower next to the stage as COMPLETE CHAOS surrounds them.  83.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Look, obviously I didn’t hit you on purpose. I said I’m sorry. A stripper falls off the stage and lands on them.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHERFUCKER
dialogues.text: All right. I’m done with this shit! Motherfucker stands.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: MOTHERFUCKER
dialogues.text: Home. You guys are a bad influence on me. He scurries toward the exit.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Motherfucker Quang, wait! We’1l give you fifty thousand shares!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're seeing the chaos from above, through an interior window.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (Spanish with subtitles) What’s going on down there? REVEAL OSCAR, 30's, a tough as nails Arafia Pandilla memb with the word “J€f€”" tattooed across his forehead (think Javier Bardem). He smokes a cigarette and maintains an ee calm, even under the most extreme circumstances. As he looks out a window onto the floor of the club, two MEMBERS bundle stacks of cash behind him.

dialogues.speaker: GANG MEMBER
dialogues.text: (Spanish with subtitles) Some kind of fight. Oscar notices the two guards who came in from outside are among the fighters.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: (calmly) Who's guarding my fucking truck? Oscar puts the cigarette in his mouth and heads out of th office.  84.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar goes down the stairs and into the war zone of the c As he heads for the back door, he is completely unfazed b the violence around him. He’s like Robert Duvall in “Apocalypse Now,” but instead of explosions, he walks thr flying chairs and bottles. EXT. TRUCK —- CONTINUOUS The 18-wheeler sits in the lot. A very faint light can be seen coming from inside the cab.

dialogues.speaker: DALE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: We're looking for a red wire with a green or yellow stripe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Dale crouch on the floor of the truck. Nick hold handful of wires from under the steering column while Dal follows instruction on his smartphone.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I see a blue wire with a yellow stripe--

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: No! Don’t touch that one!

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Calm down. We’re not defusing a nuclear warhead.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Right. Sorry. I’ma little jumpy.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Here’s a red wire.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Okay good. According to this wiki, that should be the power wire. We need to connect that to the starter wire.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Which is the starter wire?

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Hang on, it’s loading. (beat) Loading...  85.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Come on, Dale.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: I can’t help it. It’s 3G. (beat) Loading... Suddenly, they hear a door bang shut outside.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: What was that? Dale peeks up out the window and sees Oscar emerging from club and looking around suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: (whisper yell) Someone’s coming!

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Get down! Nick yanks Dale down below the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar notices Dale’s jacket wedged into the bottom of the chain-link fence. He tosses away his cigarette as he cros to the back of the truck. He takes out his keys, unlocks rear door and opens it. He checks out the contents of the trailer (we don’t see what’s inside).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Dale huddle together, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: What’s he doing back there?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Shhh. Just then, they hear the rear door slam shut. CLOSE ON the jumble of exposed wires. The slight movement the cabin from the door slamming causes the red wire to m contact with a brown one. The two wires SPARK and we hear SFX: Truck ignition starting

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: (hushed) Yes!  86.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (hushed) No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar reacts startled to the sound of the truck starting

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: éQué diablos? He crosses to the driver’s side door and pulls it open revealing... No one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar climbs into the driver’s seat and examines the ignition. As he does, we REVEAL Nick and Dale cowering in the backseat directly behind Oscar. Oscar is about to turn in their direction when Dale spots six-pack of Coke on the floor. Without thinking, he grabs can and BASHES Oscar over the head with it.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Augghhh! Oscar crumples over in the front seat. Nick and Dale exchange a look of shock.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Jesus, Dale! Before Dale can reply, Oscar sits up.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: What the fuck was that--?! Dale hits him again. Coke spritzes out of the dented can.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (still conscious) Ow! My head! CLONK! Dale slams him again.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You son of a--

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fuck!  87. Nick and Dale can’t believe this guy is still awake.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: You're not hitting him hard enough!

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: I’m hitting as hard as I can! You try it! Nick grabs a fresh can of Coke and clocks Oscar over the head. But still Oscar fails to fall unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Damn it! Nick and Dale both start BASHING Oscar over the head with their respective cans. Coke sprays everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ouch! Shit! Oooh! At long last, Oscar slumps over, out cold. Nick and Dale catch their breath.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: God, it’s hard to knock someone out.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Especially with a soda can. There's a beat. Dale takes a sip from his battered can.

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (noticing something) Oh damn. REVERSE to see several THUGS exiting the club and hurryin toward the truck.

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We've gotta go! Nick and Dale scramble into the front seat.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: (re: Oscar) What about him?!

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Just move him over! Dale drags Oscar off the front seat as Nick slams the doo shut and grabs the gearshift.

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let’s get the hell out of here.  88. ACTION MUSIC crescendoes as Nick stomps on the gas pedal. but the truck doesn’t move. Instead, we hear a horrible GRINDING SOUND from the engine.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: What are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I don’t know how to drive a truck! There’s like eighteen gears on this thing! A GUNSHOT rings out, shattering the driver’s side window. Dale and Nick duck down.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: They're shooting at us!

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I got that. Nick continues to grind the gears and the noise gets even uglier. By now, the gang members are almost upon the truc

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on, first gear... where are you? Finally, he grinds it into gear and the truck slowly lurc forward toward the fence.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Gun it!

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I’m trying, Dale! There’s like five pedals down there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A THUG manages to leap onto the side of the cab. He climb up to the window and points his gun at Nick. Just as he’s about to fire, the truck rumbles through the fence -- not fast, but with enough speed to bust through. The torn fen scrapes along the sides of the truck and YANKS the thug f his perch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt runs out the front door of the club just as the truc clumsily barrels around the corner, the trailer jumping t curb and taking out a parking meter. Kurt hurries over as Nick slows down for him to climb abo  89.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt slams the door shut as he takes a seat behind Nick a Dale.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Took you long enough. Do you have any idea what was going on in there?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Do you have any idea what was going on in here?!

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Where’s Motherfucker?

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: He took off. Couldn’t take the heat. (then, noticing Oscar) Who’s this gentleman?

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: He’s in the gang. We knocked him out with cans.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: No shit? That’s cool.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: We should probably tie him up or something. Kurt finds some bungee cords and proceeds to tie Oscar's hands behind his back.

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are they following us?

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: (looking out the side window) I don’t see anyone. (then) Hey, what do you think is in this truck anyway?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: No idea. Could be anything. Drugs, weapons...

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Sex slaves.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: I hope it’s not sex slaves.  90.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: It’s not our business. The less we know the better. (beat) I'll go easier on the turns in case it’s sex slaves. SFX: Dale’s cell phone rings

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hey, honey. What’s up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flushed and out of breath, Stacy is on all fours on the f of the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: STACY
dialogues.text: (into speaker phone) Dale?! Where are you?! It’s four in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Uh... got stuck at the office.

dialogues.speaker: STACY
dialogues.text: Well, it’s time!

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Time for what, hon?

dialogues.speaker: STACY
dialogues.text: Time for three babies to come out of my body!

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Right now? Are you sure?! She glances over at a huge puddle of water on the floor n to her.

dialogues.speaker: STACY
dialogues.text: Pretty sure. (groans ) Ohhhhh god!

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Breathe, Stacy! Are you dilated? Is your vagina dilated?! Kurt and Nick exchange a look.  gl.

dialogues.speaker: STACY
dialogues.text: I can’t see my vagina, Dale.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Right. Okay. We’1ll be right there! Just hang on! He hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: DALE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We've got to take Stacy to the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: She’s in labor. We've got to pick her up.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: In a stolen truck full of sex slaves?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Not to mention the man with the dragon tattoo back there.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Can’t she call a cab?

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: (steely) You listen to me. My wife and babies are the most important things in the world to me. And nothing’s going to stop me from being there for them. So you either drive this fucking rig to my house and pick up Stacy or I will. He holds a Coke can and glares at Nick threateningly. Nic glances over at Kurt who shrugs. EXT. Nick car, EXT. Dale

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: takes a hard left. The trailer SCRAPES against a parked nearly totalling it. DALE’S HOUSE - MINUTES LATER and Kurt carefully help Stacy to the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this? What are you driving?

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: It’s a truck. (thinking fast) It’s the Nickurdale company truck.
Dale helps Stacy recline in the back seat as Kurt climbs the front and Nick pulls away from the curb.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Hey, Stacy. How you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: STACY
dialogues.text: Hey Nick. I didn’t know you knew how to drive a truck.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. Been driving them since I was-— He is drowned out by a DEAFENING GRINDING SOUND as he struggles to shift gears. All of a sudden, Stacy lets out a SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: What? Is it a contraction?!

dialogues.speaker: STACY
dialogues.text: There’s a man on the floor! She points to Oscar who lies unconscious at her feet.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Oh, right. That's... (sees the “Jefe” tattoo on Oscar’s forehead) Jeffy. He’s an old college pal. Latino college pal.

dialogues.speaker: STACY
dialogues.text: What’s wrong with him?

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: He’s a drunk. Big drunk. We call him Jeffy the... Drunk.

dialogues.speaker: STACY
dialogues.text: He’s got so many tattoos. He looks like a gang member.  93.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: That’s a little racist, hon.

dialogues.speaker: STACY
dialogues.text: You're right. I’m sorry. As they speak, Nick notices something out his side-view mirror.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (quietly) Kurt. Is that--? Kurt checks his mirror and sees two cars speeding up on t truck’s tail. Inside can be seen several of the Arafia Pandilla members.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Shit. Gun it. Nick floors it and the truck picks up speed. At the same time, Stacy begins to MOAN as her contractions get worse.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Hang on, babe. Just try to relax and stay calm... Dale glances out his window and sees one of the gang cars caught up and pulled alongside. A GANG MEMBER leans out h window and aims a 9MM pistol at them.

dialogues.speaker: DALE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fuck my shit!

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Hang on. He SWERVES SHARPLY to the right, putting some distance between the truck and the gang car.

dialogues.speaker: STACY
dialogues.text: What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Nothing. You just focus on keeping those babies inside for a little longer. CLOSE ON the speedometer which reads 90 MPH. Kurt checks his mirror again and sees another GANG MEMBER aiming his gun at them. SMASH! The mirror SHATTERS as a bullet strikes it.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Whoa.  94. Nick can see that the cars have taken positions on either side of the truck. Thinking fast, he swerves first left, then right, causing the trailer to JACKKNIFE just enough impact each car. The gang cars go into a spin, driving of the road and onto the shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Yes! The truck increases its distance from the pursuers.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: I think we’re losing them.

dialogues.speaker: STACY
dialogues.text: The babies?!

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: No, no! The babies are fine.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: No way. Sure enough, a PATROL CAR has pulled out and is speeding behind the truck.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Gun it.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I’m not gunning anything. It’s a cop. Nick slows down and pulls over to the side of the road. T squad car stops behind the truck and a PATROLMAN steps ou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several hundred yards back, the two cars full of gang mem have stopped and turned off their lights, waiting to see happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Patrolman approaches Nick’s window.

dialogues.speaker: PATROLMAN
dialogues.text: Do you know you were doing 90 miles an hour back there? A class 7 vehicle shouldn’t be going faster than 55.  95.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I am so sorry about that, Officer. It’s--

dialogues.speaker: PATROLMAN
dialogues.text: What are you hauling back there?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Hmm?

dialogues.speaker: PATROLMAN
dialogues.text: What’s in the trailer?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Just stuff. I don’t even know.

dialogues.speaker: DALE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Nothing secret.

dialogues.speaker: KURT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Dale! The Patrolman reacts to the disembodied voices.

dialogues.speaker: PATROLMAN
dialogues.text: All right, well, you're going to show me. Everyone out of the cab, please-- Just then, Stacy lets out a pained MOAN. PATROLMAN (CONT’D) What the hell’s going on in there? He steps up on the running board and peers into the cab. From his POV he sees Dale tending to Stacy. Oscar isn’t visible. PATROLMAN (CONT’D) Is she all right?

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: She's having a baby.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Triplets! Stacy moans again.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: That’s actually why we were speeding. We’re taking her to the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: PATROLMAN
dialogues.text: Why didn’t you say so? Come on. I'll give you an escort.  96. Suddenly, Oscar MOANS as he begins to regain consciousnes The Patrolman looks puzzled for a moment. Stacy moans aga and he shakes it off and hurries back to his car.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: All right then. As soon as the cop is gone, Dale grabs a fresh can of sod and CLOCKS Oscar over the head with it. Oscar slumps over

dialogues.speaker: STACY
dialogues.text: Why did you hit your friend with a can?!

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: (struggling to cover) It’s an inside joke. Don’t worry. The patrol car turns on its siren and pulls out. The truc follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gang members watch, pissed off, as the truck leaves w the cop.

dialogues.speaker: GANG MEMBER
dialogues.text: (Spanish with subtitles) What the fuck?

dialogues.speaker: GANG MEMBER
dialogues.text: (Spanish with subtitles) Don’t worry. We’ll get to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck ZOOMS down the road following the patrol car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck and the patrol car pull to a stop at the emerge room entrance. Dale jumps out.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: (yelling) Wheelchair! Can we get a wheelchair here?! No one comes.

dialogues.speaker: DALE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is a terrible hospital.  97. He hurries inside. Kurt and Nick help Stacy out of the tr as the cop joins them.

dialogues.speaker: STACY
dialogues.text: Oh god! They’re coming out!

dialogues.speaker: DALE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Here I am! I’m coming! Dale runs back out pushing a wheelchair and Stacy sits.

dialogues.speaker: DALE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Nick and Kurt) I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Kind of in a time crunch here, Dale.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: I know. But I got us into this and I’m not gonna send you there without me. (wheeling Stacy inside) Wish us luck! Dale and Stacy go.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (to Patrolman) Thank you, Officer. You’ve been a big help.

dialogues.speaker: PATROLMAN
dialogues.text: My pleasure. Y’know, I’ve always wanted to do that: escort a pregnant lady to the hospital. It’s kind of the reason I became a cop.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Aww, that’s nice.

dialogues.speaker: PATROLMAN
dialogues.text: That and getting to shoot people.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Aww. (then) Well, we don’t want to keep you, SO...  98.

dialogues.speaker: PATROLMAN
dialogues.text: Just going to need to see the contents of your trailer.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: I'm sorry?

dialogues.speaker: PATROLMAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, you didn’t get to show me before. Nick and Kurt exchange a fearful look.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Uhhh...

dialogues.speaker: PATROLMAN
dialogues.text: (no nonsense) Let's go. Nick lets out a sigh and slowly leads the Patrolman towar the rear door of the trailer. He and Kurt stand there, staring at the door for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Here we are...

dialogues.speaker: PATROLMAN
dialogues.text: Open it, please.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Yup. Nick unlatches the door and slides it up, revealing the trailer’s interior. The patrolman shines his flashlight inside.

dialogues.speaker: PATROLMAN
dialogues.text: Holy crap. REVERSE ANGLE to reveal stacked boxes labeled “DORA THE EXPLORER PLUSH DOLLS.” Kurt and Nick exhale, relieved. PATROLMAN (CONT’D) My daughter would cream her jeans if she saw this.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Big “Dora the Explorer” fan, is she?

dialogues.speaker: PATROLMAN
dialogues.text: Oh my god. She loves that little bitch.  99.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Why don’t you take one for your daughter?

dialogues.speaker: PATROLMAN
dialogues.text: Yeah? Kurt hops onto the trailer and tears open a box. He hands Dora doll to the cop.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Here, y'know what? Take a Boots the Monkey, too. He hands the cop another doll.

dialogues.speaker: PATROLMAN
dialogues.text: Thanks, guys. When my daughter sees these, she’s gonna blow a load. Kurt and Nick look a bit disgusted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Kurt climb back into the cab.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Why the hell would Nagopian want a truck full of Nick Jr. dolls?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I don’t know and I don’t care. But we're not waiting anymore. We've got to get this truck back by sun- up. Nick GRINDS the truck into gear.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. What’s with the whole “sun-up” thing, by the way? He couldn't just give us a time? This isn’t “High Noon.” Even that had a time. Noon. Before Nick pulls out, they see Dale running up.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Hey, wait! I’m ready to go!

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: What about the babies?  100.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: She had ‘em! Two boys and a girl! And some poop. But I’m a dad! He climbs aboard and they pull out.

dialogues.speaker: DALE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You weren’t going to leave without me, were you?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Sun's coming up, Dale. We're running out of time.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Check it out. He shows them a photo on his phone. INSERT: Stacy struggling to hold THREE NEWBORN BABIES

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Congratulations, Dale.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Adorable. (beat) Is the one on the right a little wonky? INSERT: the same photo. The one on the right is smaller a goofier looking than his siblings.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Milo? He’s not wonky. He’s just a little smaller than the other two.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: They're all beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Thank you. He sits back. Nick leans toward Kurt.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (sotto) There’s definitely something going on with Milo.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Right? (then, checks watch) I think we’re okay. I think we’re gonna make it back to Nagopian in time.  101.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: So you're working for that piece of crap? The guys jump, startled. Oscar has regained consciousness his hands still tied.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I should've figured.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (re: Oscar) Shit. I forgot about him.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: What I don’t understand is, why would Nagopian hire three putos like you?

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: If we’re such putos, how did we steal your truck and knock you out?

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Yeah! And what’s a puto? Oscar smiles calmly.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: You have no idea what kind of shit you're in.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: What about you? I hate to think what Nagopian’s going to do to you when we get there.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: I’m not worried.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: If you’re not worried, then why are you crying? (looking closer) Oh wait. That’s a tattoo.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Whatever happens to me, my men will find you and kill you.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: You have “men”? Why do you have “men"?

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Because I’m the leader of the Arafa Pandilla.  102. EXT. TRUCK —- CONTINUOUS Nick JAMS ON the brakes and the truck SQUEALS to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (to Oscar) You're the gang leader?!

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: What do you think this fucking tattoo on my forehead says?

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Jeffy. Isn’t your name Jeffy?

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Jefe. It means “boss”! Didn’t any of you take Spanish in school?

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: I took French.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: (to Nick and Dale) Why did you guys kidnap the gang leader?!

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: He got in the truck. We didn’t have a choice.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: What do we do with him?

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: You let me go.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: We're not letting you go. (then, quietly to Nick) Should we let him go? Dale leans forward to listen.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I don’t know. If we take him to Nagopian he'll probably kill him.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Yeah. But if we let him out, he’1l kill us.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: How? His hands are tied.  103.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: They won’t be tied forever, Dale. (then) Maybe we can make a deal with him. We let him go and Nagopian doesn’t kill him. And in return for saving his life, he lets us off the hook.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Seems reasonable. (turning to Oscar) How does that sound, Jeffy? They all look to see the rear truck door is open and Osca gone.

dialogues.speaker: KURT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where did he go?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale and Kurt get out of the truck and look around.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: He’s gone. (calling) Jeffy?!

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: You think he’s going to come back if you call him?

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Forget about him. The sun is coming up. Let’s get this damn truck back.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: How did he open the door with his hands tied? He’s like a Dominican ninja. A Dominja. We hear horrible GRINDING SOUNDS from the transmission an Kurt and Dale climb in as the truck jerks forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is just rising as the 18-wheeler pulls up to Nagopian’s office trailer. Nagopian and Ghoukas exit the trailer as Nick, Kurt and Dale step down from the truck.

dialogues.speaker: MR. NAGOPIAN
dialogues.text: You actually made it? No fucking way.  104.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Yes, fucking way. Here’s your truck. Are we done now?

dialogues.speaker: MR. NAGOPIAN
dialogues.text: One moment. Ghoukas. Ghoukas crosses to the back of the truck.

dialogues.speaker: MR. NAGOPIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How did you get past the Dominicans?

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: You ever see “Oceans 11”?

dialogues.speaker: MR. NAGOPIAN
dialogues.text: With Catherine Zeta-Jones?

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: (frustrated) No. Ghoukas returns with a Dora the Explorer doll and hands i Nagopian.

dialogues.speaker: DALE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: That’s what was in the truck.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: (to Nagopian) Why did you need a bunch of dolls so badly? Nagopian yanks the head off the doll and pulls out a bagg filled with powder.

dialogues.speaker: KURT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ah. Right. Drugs of some sort. That makes more sense.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (leaning in) We gave them to that cop’s daughter.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: (sotto) Ooh. Probably shouldn’t have, huh?

dialogues.speaker: MR. NAGOPIAN
dialogues.text: I have to admit, I’m impressed. I didn’t think you mongoloids would pull it off.  105.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: So, are we... good?

dialogues.speaker: MR. NAGOPIAN
dialogues.text: Well, since you did bring me a truck worth 20 million dollars, I’m going to forgive your debt.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Oh, thank god.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: 20 million? (whistles) If anything, you should pay us more.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (quickly) He’s kidding. Thank you, Mr. Nagopian. We're really glad we could work this all out without any of us... being killed.

dialogues.speaker: MR. NAGOPIAN
dialogues.text: Ghoukas, call our friends a cab. They shake hands with Nagopian just as a car pulls up, dr by a WOMAN. Nagopian hands the Dora doll to Ghoukas who takes it away. The woman steps out of the car. Dale looks at her. Why do she look familiar?

dialogues.speaker: MR. NAGOPIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hello, dear.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Hi, hon. Gabe and I wanted to say goodbye before we head for the airport. Dale looks even more uneasy. The woman opens the rear passenger door and out steps Gab THE BOY WHO DALE HELPED GO TO THE BATHROOM. Dale’s jaw drops.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: (to himself) No fucking way. Nagopian gives his wife a kiss and lifts up his son for a hug.  There’s a disbelief. 106.

dialogues.speaker: MR. NAGOPIAN
dialogues.text: How’s my little monster?

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: (nervously) Well, we should get out of your hair.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: We're waiting for a cab, Dale.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: (getting panicky) That’s okay. We don’t need a cab. GABE’S MOTHER (noticing Dale) Hey, don’t you work for Gabe’s dentist?

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Hm? No. What? I don’t think so. (to Nick and Kurt) Time to go, guys. Come on. GABE’S MOTHER Yeah, you work with Dr. Slocum.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Don’t know who that is.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: What is your problem? You did work for Dr. Slocum.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Nope! Different person. Let’s go.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: I know you.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: No, you don’t.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Yeah, you’re the man who took out my penis. stunned silence. Nick and Kurt exchange a look of Dale forces a laugh.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: What?! Where did that come from?  107.

dialogues.speaker: MR. NAGOPIAN
dialogues.text: What are you saying, Gabe? This man? He touched you?

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Just my penis.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Okay, hang on! Gabe asked me to do it! He was practically begging me-- Mrs. Nagopian gasps. Nagopian’s expression turns stone co as he glares at Dale.

dialogues.speaker: DALE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let me back up. I took him to the bathroom. Come on, Gabe. Tell them why I did it.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Why not?!

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: You said we had to keep it secret.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Oh damn. (to Kurt) Should we--?

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Run? Yeah. They grab Dale’s arm and take off RUNNING toward the exit the construction site.

dialogues.speaker: MR. NAGOPIAN
dialogues.text: Ghoukas!

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: (breathing hard) God damn it, Dale. We were off the hook!

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Of all the kids you could've molested...

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: I didn’t molest anyone! As they approach the exit, two cars speed onto the construction site.  108. Oscar hangs out the passenger window of one car, holding gun. He rides with a half dozen of his tattooed GANG MEMBERS.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Is that--?

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: It's Jeffy! Oscar aims and FIRES his gun, narrowly missing them. Grav flies up beside them.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: This way! Nick, Kurt and Dale retreat back the way they came. But before they get far, they see Nagopian, Ghoukas and anoth THUG leave the office trailer carrying weapons.

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Not this way! Nagopian’s thug aims his Uzi at the guys, but before he c fire, he is SHOT IN THE ARM by one of the Dominicans. Caught in the crossfire, our guys duck and scramble for cover. Kurt spots the main entrance to the unfinished 10- story office building.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Over here! As the two gangs take pot shots at each other, Nick, Kurt Dale scurry into the building. ANGLE ON Nagopian and Ghoukas, who see them go in and hur after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, Kurt and Dale race up the emergency stairs. The hig they go, the more unfinished the building is. They stop o the third floor to catch their breath. They can hear gunf from outside. Nick pulls out his cell phone and dials.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Who are you calling?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: My mom. (then)
Dale peers down the open area of the staircase.  109.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: I don’t see anyone-- P-TING! A bullet RICOCHETS off the railing beside Dale. REVEAL Nagopian and Ghoukas at the bottom of the stairs aiming up at them.

dialogues.speaker: MR. NAGOPIAN
dialogues.text: I’m going to put a bullet in your balls!

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: (calling down) He was gonna pee in his pants! I helped him-- P-TING! Another bullet flies past.

dialogues.speaker: DALE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Kurt) He doesn’t want to listen. The guys continue up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (into phone) Yes, hello. There are Dominicans and Armenians shooting at us! (beat) Well, it’s a long story. The main thing to focus on is that they’re shooting at us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An SUV pulls up and unloads four ARMENIAN MOBSTERS, all carrying automatic weapons. They take cover as the Arafa Pandilla turn their fire on them. Oscar slips into the unfinished building and heads for th stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, Kurt and Dale are now at the top floor. Nick’s stil on the phone. They leave the stairwell and take cover beh a stack of drywall. There are no outside walls or windows only plastic sheets which flutter in the wind.

dialogues.speaker: SFX
dialogues.text: Nick looks at his phone to see an incoming call. The call ID reads: “SKYMALL INC.”  110.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (showing Kurt and Dale) Guys, look.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: SkyMall? What could they want?

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Maybe they had second thoughts about the Shower Buddy. Take it.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Not the best time for a business call, Kurt. We’re about to be shot to death.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Exactly. Wouldn’t you rather die knowing that we’re not just three idiots who quit their jobs for no reason? Nick hesitates. Kurt grabs the phone from him and answers the call, putting 911 on hold.

dialogues.speaker: KURT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (“casually” into phone) Nickurdale Industries, this is Kurt.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (on phone) Kurt, hi, it’s Claire Robbins from SkyMall. Hope we’re not catching you too early.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: No, no, this is a great time. BANG! A shot overhead showers the guys with drywall piece Kurt peeks out from his cover to find Nagopian and Ghouka scanning the room for them. A piece of plastic blows in f the wind. Ghoukas FIRES at it.

dialogues.speaker: MR. NAGOPIAN
dialogues.text: We're going to find you fuckers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire is on the phone at her desk.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: What is that noise?  111.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: (quietly) I’m just down on the factory floor. How can I help you, Claire? As Claire speaks, the three crawl behind various piles of construction equipment to avoid being found by the Armeni

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Well, despite our misgivings about you and your colleagues on a personal level, we showed your Shower Buddy to our boss and she flipped for it.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: (full voice) Seriously? (to Nick and Dale) They like the Buddy! BANG! Hearing Kurt’s voice, Nagopian fires in his directi Nick, Kurt and Dale hustle for a new hiding spot.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (to Kurt) Shhh!

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: We do have a couple of questions, though, before we can make an order.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Sure, sure. That’s great. Do you think we could call you back a little later in the day?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Unfortunately, we go to press on our fall catalogue today, so it’s kind of a now-or-never situation. That’s why we’re calling so early.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: I see. Okay, well, we’ll be happy to answer your questions--— He peeks out from his hiding spot and sees Oscar and four his thugs run in with weapons drawn.

dialogues.speaker: KURT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to himself) Holy shit. Nagopian and Ghoukas take cover as Oscar and his men turn their attention to them.  112.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: You think you can steal from me, pendejo?!

dialogues.speaker: MR. NAGOPIAN
dialogues.text: Jaj tam vret! They open fire on each other. BANG, BANG, BANG! Kurt, Nic and Dale cower.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Was that gunfire?

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Nope. Those are... bolt guns. They're shooting bolts into the thing.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: All right, well, first of all, we need to know if the estimates you gave us on your maximum output capacity were theoretical or rated? One of the Arafia Pandilla members is SHOT multiple times collapses directly over where Kurt is hiding, dropping hi gun and BLEEDING DOWN ONTO KURT’S HEAD.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: (reacting) Ugghhh. (then, keeping it together) Those estimates were rated, based on actual productivity figures over a two week period-- Pfft! Kurt spits blood out of his mouth that has dripped down f the fallen gang member above him.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Okay, good. And tell me about your replenishment lead time. More of Nagopian’s men have joined the battle on the top floor. It’s an all-out gang war. Struggling to see despite the blood that has dripped into eyes, Kurt spots an Armenian THUG heading in his directio

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: (spits more blood) Pfft! I’m gonna hand you over to my co-CEO, Nick. He can tell you all about our (loudly for Nick’s sake) replenishment lead time.  113. Kurt tosses the phone to Nick and scrambles for cover on hands and knees. As Nick speaks, he “army crawls” under a tarp.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Hi, Claire. As far as our RLT goes, our assembly line can produce 75 completed units per hour, so we can meet any orders with a minimum of lead time-- BANG! A bullet rips through the tarp just over Nick. He flinches.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Is everything okay there?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Everything's just f--UCK! Nick holds up his left hand which we see has a BULLET HOL IT.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Excuse me? Freaking out, Nick spots Dale hiding nearby.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (pained) I’m gonna transfer you to my colleague, Dale. DALE! Nick throws the phone at Dale and grabs his hand in agony

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: (into phone) Dale here.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Um, hello. I was just going to ask if your manufacturing cycle efficiency matches the throughput estimates from your production spec sheet. Dale hasn’t the slightest idea what Claire’s talking abou

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: That’s all we needed to know. Welcome to the SkyMall family.  114.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: Thanks, lady! Claire shrugs and hangs up. Dale pumps his fist victoriously.

dialogues.speaker: DALE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Guys, we did it! He looks over at Kurt who is disgustedly wiping blood fro his face, then at Nick who is frantically wrapping his bl hand.

dialogues.speaker: DALE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whoa. Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: No, I’m not okay! I got shot in the fucking hand!

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: I swallowed gangster blood! (noticing) Oh shit. They turn to see Oscar stalking straight toward them, his drawn.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: And now you learn what happens when you kidnap the head of the Arafa P-- BLAM! A bullet blasts right through Oscar’s head, SPLATTERING ONLY KURT’S FACE WITH BLOOD.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Ugghh! With the blood. Pfft! Oscar falls, revealing Nagopian standing behind him, his gun drawn.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: You saved our lives.

dialogues.speaker: MR. NAGOPIAN
dialogues.text: I was aiming at you. He got in the way.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: (disappointed) Oh. Nagopian takes aim directly at Dale. Dale cringes. Nick spots a wheelbarrow filled with POWDERED CONCRETE. He gra a handful and TOSSES it into Nagopian’s face, momentarily blinding him.  They take when they They head recovered 115.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (clutching his wounded and now concrete caked hand) Ow!

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Come on! off running in the direction of the stairs but stop see Ghoukas blocking their path.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Ghoukas. off in another direction. By now, Nagopian has and is hunting them down. Our guys find themselves at the edge of the building with HUNDRED FOOT DROP IN FRONT OF THEM.

dialogues.speaker: DALE
dialogues.text: It’s a dead end.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: There’s no way down.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Wait, look. Kurt points to a construction debris chute (like a waterslide) that leads to a dumpster below.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? We wouldn’t survive that.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Sure we will. It’s just like the slides at Raging Waters.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Yeah, if those slides ended in a dumpster full of sharp metal! Nagopian and Ghoukas are closing in.

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Well, I’m going. Kurt jumps feet first into the slide and disappears. Nick and Dale look at each other for a beat. Dale shrugs and jumps into the slide. Nick sighs.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: God damn it.  116. He follows his friends down the chute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt BARRELS down the dusty slide.

dialogues.speaker: WHOAAAAHHHHH
dialogues.text: Right behind him, Dale speeds along.

dialogues.speaker: AHHHHHHHHHHH
dialogues.text: Bringing up the rear is Nick.

dialogues.speaker: SHHHITIIIIIT
dialogues.text: From Kurt’s POV, we see the bottom of the chute rapidly approaching. A LONG, SHARP piece of REBAR juts into the slide, pointing directly up toward Kurt’s oncoming testic

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Oh fuck. He desperately splays out his legs and hands, slowing him down on the walls of the chute. He manages to stop his descent a MERE FOOT from the pointy end of the steel bar. UNTIL DALE SLAMS INTO HIM from behind, shoving him six in closer to the bar.

dialogues.speaker: KURT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ahh! Oof! Just then, Nick SLIDES INTO THE TWO OF THEM, shoving Kurt crotch down to within AN INCH of being impaled. Kurt takes a deep breath, then kicks the rebar to the sid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Filthy, bloody and exhausted, the three guys climb out of dumpster only to find a half dozen GUNS pointed at them.

dialogues.speaker: MAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Freeze! The guys realize they are surrounded by COPS, including Hagan. A couple SWAT team vans unload and take up positio around the building.  117.

dialogues.speaker: HAGAN
dialogues.text: So you dildos weren't bullshitting me after all. He gestures for the cops to lower their guns. An OFFICER steps up to Hagan.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Sir, we've apprehended Nagopian.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Think you have enough evidence on him now, Detective? Hagan gives him a look.

dialogues.speaker: HAGAN
dialogues.text: You guys okay?

dialogues.speaker: KURT
dialogues.text: Yeah. (re: the blood crusted on his face) Think I could get an AIDS test? Nick’s cell phone rings. It’s SkyMall again.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It’s Claire Robbins again. I’m sorry, I forgot one last thing.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: What’s that?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Your company name. Nickurdale? It kinda sounds like... (whispers) “N-word Dale.” Any way you could change it?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Hmm, never occurred to us. But sure, we can change it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A RECEPTIONIST picks up the phone.  118.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: (into phone) Thank you for calling Danickur. (pronounced “da nigger”) How may I direct your call? PULL BACK to reveal the NEW COMPANY NAME on the wall behi her: “DANICKUR INDUSTRIES” TRACK THROUGH the now bustling office, filled with activi We pass a stack of SkyMall catalogues on a coffee table, Shower Buddy is on the cover. dialogues.text: It’s total chaos as naked INMATES slip and slide on the cement floor, trying desperately to get their footing. A couple GUARDS try to help, but wind up falling into the writhing mass of nude criminals. FADE OUT.
